intro: Comanthera bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia comanthera, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and prefers well-drained soil. It has a woody stem and produces small, clustered leaves. Comanthera bahiensis is often found in forest understories and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
